FormDesign.formTitle: Colon and Rectum Biomarker Reporting Template

Property.name: Copyright
Property.val: (c) 2021 College of American Pathologists. All rights reserved. License required for use.

Property.name: OfficialName
Property.val: Colon and Rectum Biomarker Reporting Template

Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Use of this template is optional.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_364858
DisplayedItem.title: Includes elements from the 2016 HER2 Testing and Clinical Decision Making in Gastroesophageal Adenocarcinoma: Guideline From the College of American Pathologists, American Society for Clinical Pathology, and American Society of Clinical Oncology.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_29722
DisplayedItem.title: Completion of the template is the responsibility of the laboratory performing the biomarker testing and / or providing the interpretation. When both testing and interpretation are performed elsewhere (e.g., a reference laboratory), synoptic reporting of the results by the laboratory submitting the tissue for testing is also encouraged to ensure that all information is included in the patient’s medical record and thus readily available to the treating clinical team.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_29936
DisplayedItem.title: Fixative type, time to fixation (cold ischemia time), and time of fixation should be reported if applicable in this template or in the original pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_32236
DisplayedItem.title: Gene names should follow recommendations of The Human Genome Organization (HUGO) Nomenclature Committee (www.genenames.org).

DisplayedItem.name: DI_32235
DisplayedItem.title: All reported gene sequence variations should be identified following the recommendations of the Human Genome Variation Society (www.hgvs.org/rec).

Question.name: Q_29485
Question.title: Immunohistochemistry (IHC) Testing for Mismatch Repair (MMR) Proteins

ListItem.name: LI_29504
ListItem.title: Background nonneoplastic tissue / internal control with intact nuclear expression

ListItem.name: LI_29506
ListItem.title: No loss of nuclear expression of MMR proteins: low probability of MSI-H

ListItem.name: LI_29507
ListItem.title: Loss of nuclear expression of MLH1 and PMS2: testing for methylation of the MLH1 promoter and / or mutation of BRAF is indicated (the presence of a BRAF V600E mutation and / or MLH1 methylation suggests that the tumor is sporadic and germline evaluation is probably not indicated; absence of both MLH1 methylation and of BRAF V600E mutation suggests the possibility of Lynch syndrome and sequencing and / or large deletion / duplication testing of germline MLH1 may be indicated)

ListItem.name: LI_29508
ListItem.title: Loss of nuclear expression of MSH2 and MSH6: high probability of Lynch syndrome (sequencing and / or large deletion / duplication testing of germline MSH2 may be indicated and, if negative, sequencing and / or large deletion / duplication testing of germline MSH6 may be indicated)

ListItem.name: LI_29509
ListItem.title: Loss of nuclear expression of MSH6 only: high probability of Lynch syndrome (sequencing and / or large deletion / duplication testing of germline MSH6 may be indicated)

ListItem.name: LI_29510
ListItem.title: Loss of nuclear expression of PMS2 only: high probability of Lynch syndrome (sequencing and / or large deletion / duplication testing of germline PMS2 may be indicated)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_29511
DisplayedItem.title: # There are exceptions to the above IHC interpretations. These results should not be considered in isolation, and clinical correlation with genetic counseling is recommended to assess the need for germline testing.

ListItem.name: LI_29516
ListItem.title: 1-29% of the National Cancer Institute (NCI) or mononucleotide markers exhibit instability

ListItem.name: LI_29517
ListItem.title: 1 of the NCI or mononucleotide markers exhibits instability

ListItem.name: LI_29520
ListItem.title: Greater than equal to 30% of the NCI or mononucleotide markers exhibit instability

ListItem.name: LI_29521
ListItem.title: 2 or more of the NCI or mononucleotide markers exhibit instability

ListItem.name: LI_29615
ListItem.title: Positive cytoplasmic and / or nuclear expression

ListItem.name: LI_29616
ListItem.title: Negative for cytoplasmic and nuclear expression

Section.name: S_29622
Section.title: Multiparameter Gene Expression / Protein Expression Assay

ListItem.name: LI_380984
ListItem.title: CAP / ASCP / ASCO HER2 Gastroesophageal Adenocarcinoma 2016 (aka Ventana)

Question.title: Average Number of HER2 (ERBB2) Signals per Cancer Cell
